title: Strictly Come Dancing: How do you film during a pandemic?
description: The BBC has revealed how it will protect celebrities, dancers and crew working on the show.

title: Meng Wanzhou: The PowerPoint that sparked an international row
description: The top Huawei executive's closely watched extradition case returns to court on Monday.

title: Test and Trace: 'I spoke to one person in four months'
description: People who worked for England's NHS Test and Trace tell of technical problems, confusion and wasted resources.

title: Voicemail from prison: How a mum and daughter rebuilt their relationship
description: A voicemail app makes it easier to speak to family members in prison, as one young woman found when her mum was jailed.

title: Coronavirus tales from Tom's Bench on Clapham Common
description: Jim Grover's pictures of people he met on Clapham Common who talked about their altered lives.

title: Orkney island of Westray claims to have UK's longest golf hole
description: The monster 738-yard hole on the Orkney island of Westray is one of the longest in the world.

title: High Street hopefuls: The people opening new shops
description: The entrepreneurs opening High Street businesses during Covid when others have closed or gone digital.

title: The woman who quit smoking and built a hypnotherapy firm
description: Grace Smith used hypnosis to give up smoking, and it inspired her to take up the profession.

title: Covid: Dementia patient's wife describes 'torture' of lack of visits
description: A woman describes her pain at not being able to see her husband regularly at his care home.

title: 'Man City have bigger problems than defence' - Darren Fletcher analysis
description: Darren Fletcher explains how Manchester City's problems in their shock 5-2 defeat by Leicester go deeper than just poor play by their defenders.

title: Local food heroes: Tesco teams up with Olio
description: Supermarket chain Tesco has teamed up with the food-sharing app Olio in a bid to reduce food waste.

title: Coronavirus: 'Forced to work' as medics fighting Covid
description: Almost 200 health workers have died of Covid-19 in Venezuela since the pandemic began in March.

title: Croydon police shooting: Crime scenes searched over Sgt Matt Ratana death
description: More tributes are paid to Sgt Matiu Ratana as police continue their investigation into his death.

title: Coronavirus: Culture Secretary Oliver Dowden defends students' university return
description: It comes as scientists warn university outbreaks are "entirely predictable" and had been modelled.

title: Coronavirus: Labour 'sympathetic' to rebel MPs over virus law
description: David Lammy says his party could support Tories looking to increase scrutiny of Coronavirus rules.

title: Coronavirus: David Lammy warns that people are 'bubbling out of pubs' due to curfew
description: Shadow justice secretary David Lammy says drinkers are likely to continue their night together at home.

title: Azerbaijan and Armenia clash over disputed Nagorno-Karabakh region
description: Civilian deaths are reported as the two sides blame each other for hostilities over Nagorno-Karabakh.

title: Switzerland firmly rejects end of free movement with EU - projection
description: Projections suggest a referendum on annulling a pact with the European Union has failed.

title: Sharp Covid-19 infections spike in Scottish teens
description: Infections in 15-19 year olds account for more than 40% of new cases as student outbreaks grow.

title: Dowden offers hope for smaller football clubs
description: A deal for the Premier League to support lower-league clubs during the coronavirus pandemic "could be reached this week", according to Culture Secretary Oliver Dowden.

title: Negative interest rates: Bank of England policymaker defends plan
description: Silvana Tenreyro said evidence from countries that have introduced the policy was “encouraging”.

title: Japanese actress Yuko Takeuchi found dead at 40
description: The award-winning actress and mother of two is believed to have taken her own life.

title: Amy Coney Barrett: Trump nominates conservative favourite for Supreme Court
description: The nomination of a conservative judge paves the way for a bitter Senate fight as an election looms.

title: The Papers: Johnson 'faces Covid revolt', and Charles' warning
description: A mixture of stories lead the front of Sunday's newspaper front pages.
